result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael W Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court sentenced defendant to a total of 5 years confinement in WSP; Initial confinement of 2 years and 6 months, 2 years and 6 months Extended Supervision, with credit for 117 days time served,  Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION.
Conditions same as Probation, with the exception of condition time.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

miscConds.notes: Fine of $600.00, all court costs, fees, surcharges and mandatory DNA surcharge.

Additional payments due the firs tof the month, each moth until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant Michael W Anderson in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Michael W Anderson in custody.  Thomas Potter for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1,012.59 paid to WI Department of Transportation, PO Box 7915, Madison, WI 53707.    Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $50.00 per month with the first payment due on 11/01/2014 and additional payments due the 1st of the month each month until paid in full.  Failure to pay will result in civil judgment.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Michael W Anderson not in court, in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated off the record to the Court, and with the approval of all parties, Restitution Hearing adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.  Restitution hearing scheduled for 08-14-2014 at 08:30 am.
FILE REMAINS IN COURTROOM PENDING RESTITUTION HEARING.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, FILED.
Court Order For IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment And Driver Safety Plan, SIGNED AND FILED.
FILED.
Of Right To Seek Postconviction Relief, FILED.
FILED.

Defendant Michael W Anderson in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeds. No corrections made to PSI report. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and 6 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS and 6 MONTHS. Credit given for 117 days time served if revoked.  25% of prison funds, collected by Department of Corrections, to go toward all court ordered monetary obligations, with restitution having first priority, all other monetary obligations thereafter, if revoked.
.
COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.
-
Court orders defendant to serve 9 MONTHS CONDITION TIME IN THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION, with the FIRST 2 MONTHS being served STRAIGHT TIME, FINAL 7 MONTHS being served with HUBER FOR WORK.  Defendant's request for Good Time Release DENIED .  Defendant remanded to Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department;
-absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs;
-no possession,consumption,selling,distributing of illegal drugs/alcohol;
-random urine screens; if deemed appropriate;
-pay restitution in the amount TO BE DETERMINED AT RESTITUTION HEARING SCHEDULED FOR 08-05-2014 AT 01:30PM; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-provide a DNA sample;
-pay MANDATORY DNA surcharge; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all applicable fees of supervision;  failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
-
-  A payment plan for all monetary obligations is to be established by Department of Corrections, Probation and Parole.  All unpaid monetary balances at the end of said period will convert to a civil judgment.
-  No Cash Bail was posted in this matter.
-  Firearm/Voting Rights/Civil Judgment Warnings given.
-
-  Court ORDERS Defendant to pay a Fine in the amount of $600.00.
-  Court ORDERS Defendant's Driver's License SUSPENDED for a period of 2 YEARS and 6 MONTHS.
-  Court ORDERS Ignition Interlock Device be installed on Defendant's Vehicle(s) for a period of 18 MONTHS upon reissuance of drivers license.
-  Court ORDERS Defendant to pay for installation and maintenance of IID.
-  Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment And Driver Safety Plan, SIGNED AND FILED.
-
Court advised defendant on Extended Confinement or "bad time".
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant ISeligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Appeal rights given. Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Acknowledgment of ineligibility  Copies given to defendant.
  Restitution hearing scheduled for 08-05-2014 at 01:30 pm.
